A Stitch in Time by Kelley Armstrong

A time-slip mystery. First in the series.
Bronwyn has inherited an old house she remembers having a ghost when she visited as a young girl. They were friends and playmates. Now that she has returned to Thorne Manor she finds she still has the ability to slip through time and interact with William in his time. They are the same age and resume their friendship which turns into more.

Armstrong has a talent for making the paranormal, the frightening, and the unusual all seem normal. Or almost normal.

Imagine being thirty-eight years old and returning to your aunt's home that she has just willed to you in a quaint village in England. This is where we find our narrator Bronwyn. The reader quickly finds out though that this home does not hold all good memories for Bronwyn. The last time she was in the house a great tragedy happened, a tragedy that changed the course of her life forever and altered the person that she is today.

A haunted house, unsolved murders, & a time travel romance.

Years after a tragic accident took place there, Bronwyn returns to a beloved haunted old manor on the English moors. When her childhood dreams of ghosts & an old love prove to be true memories, Bronwyn travels back to Victorian times to meet her old boyfriend. Yet the ghosts in her present time are desperate for release. Desperate enough to cause another tragic accident, one that Bronwyn won't be able to escape from again.

review_text: This novella was adorable. It reminded me a lot of one of my favorite books, The Hating Game, but there were also differences intertwined. I loved Riley and Kennedy so much. Each of them had pretty significant baggage coming into this "deal". Riley was looking for love and Kennedy wasn't sure what he was looking for but commitment wasn't on his radar. I feel like the first time he bantered with Riley he knew she would be more to him. It was so cute.

I didn't care for how the narration was done - female and male narrators switching after each chapter and each reading both the female and male dialogues for their chapters. This was a cute(ish) seasonal read. I wasn't a huge fan of the MCs, especially Kennedy and his stalkerish behavior.

Pride and Prejudice is a love story surrounding the young Elisabeth Bennet in 19th England. Her parents are desperate for at least one of their five daughters to find a wealthy husband. Austen's story touches on topics such as marrying for love, social prestige, manners and the pressure to assure financial security.

Eleanor & Park is the first young adult novel written by Rainbow Rowell. Published in 2012.

The story follows dual narratives by Eleanor Douglas and Park Sheridan, two misfits living in Omaha, Nebraska from 1986 to 1987.

Eleanor, a chubby 16-year-old girl with curly red hair, and Park, a half-Korean, 16-year-old boy, meet on a school bus on Eleanor's first day at the school and gradually connect through comic books and mix tapes of '80s music, sparking a love story.
